title: Title Case String
description: Convert a string to title case (capitalize first letter of each word)
instructions:
Write a function `titleCase(str)` that converts a string to title case, where the first letter of each word is capitalized and all other letters are lowercase.

Example: titleCase('hello world') should return 'Hello World'
Example: titleCase('javaScript is FUN') should return 'Javascript Is Fun'

hints.content: Break the string into individual words, capitalize the first letter of each word, then join them back together.
Use .split(' ') to get an array of words. For each word, take the first character (.toUpperCase()) and concatenate it with the rest of the word (.slice(1)). Finally, .join(' ') the words back.
Split: `const words = str.toLowerCase().split(' ');`. Loop and modify: `words[i] = words[i][0].toUpperCase() + words[i].slice(1);`. Join: `return words.join(' ');`
